DataElement.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Detection Cytogenetic Analysis Method Disease Marker Laboratory Procedure Outcome
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._The activity of perceiving, discerning, discovering or identifying._Techniques for analysis of chromosomal and subchromosomal properties and structures, such as those to diagnose, classify, screen for, or manage genetic diseases and abnormalities._A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal._Specific molecular signature of disease, physiological measurement, genotype structural or functional characteristic, metabolic changes, or other determinant that may simplify the diagnostic process, make diagnoses more accurate, distinguish different causes of disease, or enable physicians to make diagnoses before symptoms appear and to track disease progression._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._The result of an action.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Specific molecular signature of disease, physiological measurement, genotype structural or functional characteristic, metabolic changes, or other determinant that may simplify the diagnostic process, make diagnoses more accurate, distinguish different causes of disease, or enable physicians to make diagnoses before symptoms appear and to track disease progression._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._The result of an action.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding of normality following an examination or investigation looking for the presence of a microorganism, disease, or condition.

Concepts.definition: A finding of normality following an examination or investigation looking for the presence of a microorganism, disease, or condition.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated VM Short Name to be the Public ID to be consistent with current convention for VM Short Name - DW 10-03-2022

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.

Concepts.definition: A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or completed.: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.
Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Specific molecular signature of disease, physiological measurement, genotype structural or functional characteristic, metabolic changes, or other determinant that may simplify the diagnostic process, make diagnoses more accurate, distinguish different causes of disease, or enable physicians to make diagnoses before symptoms appear and to track disease progression.:A medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood, urine, or other substance from the body. Tests can help determine a diagnosis, plan treatment, check to see if treatment is working, or monitor the disease over time.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: Specific molecular signature of disease, physiological measurement, genotype structural or functional characteristic, metabolic changes, or other determinant that may simplify the diagnostic process, make diagnoses more accurate, distinguish different causes of disease, or enable physicians to make diagnoses before symptoms appear and to track disease progression.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

ReferenceDocuments.description: "PerformedClinicalResult.Value(ANY=>CD) WHERE PerformedClinicalResult > PerformedObservation > DefinedObservation.nameCode = ""test for Disease or Disorder Detection Cytogenetic Analysis"" AND PerformedObservation.negationIndicator = ""false""   OR  PerformedClinicalResult > PerformedObservation.negationIndicator WHERE PerformedObservation > DefinedObservation.nameCode = ""test for Disease or Disorder Detection Cytogenetic Analysis"" AND PerformedObservation = ""true"""
